body.p: His Excellency the Governer of Kentucky

The undersigned W. A Aikman Respectfully represents that at present August Term of the Laurel Circuit Court he was fined $20. for gaming, He says he is not a gambler, but merely played the game with some acquaintances and friends and there was some small amount but, he is a citizen of London Ky has a family to support, and makes his living by blacksmithing & not by gaming,, He thinks the costs of the proceeding under the circumstances would be a sufficent penalty,
He made no defense, plead guilty, and now throws himself on the clemency of ofthe Executive
I am well acquainted with the petitioner, who is a citizen of our Town, an industrious blacksmith, a poor man with a family to support & I hope your Excellency will remit the fine against him
I am acquainted with the petitioner and the case and believe that the fine ought to be remited

Yours Respt
Granville Pearl
Thos J. Canifax Presiding Judge of the Laurel County court
N. B. Jones
W. H. H. Thompson
J. Q. A. Sproul

Laurel Cir. Ct
$20. } Gaming
W. A Aikman

Fine remitted
J F Robinson
Issd. Aug 29. 1863
